newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end firm on Wall Street, growth news.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end firm on Wall Street, growth news.

text.p: Chilean blue chips closed higher in steady trade with the market bolstered by Wall Street's surge and lower-than-expected economic growth in January, said dealers.
The market is expected to open cautiously with attention focused on the Federal Reserve's policy meeting on Tuesday, they said.
The selective index ended up 0.37 percent at 113.34 points. The general firmed 0.17 percent to 5,269.57 points on turnover of 11.6 billion pesos.
Investors reacted positively to news the economy grew just 4.7 percent in January, which boosted hopes the Central Bank could soon cut interest rates again, they said.
"The economy has slowed right down which is good news," said one dealer. "We can now expect to see lower rates in the near future."
Analysts had forecast the Imacec index would show the economy growing between 5-5.5 percent in January.
Power stocks gained ground on hopes heavy rainfall at the weekend could herald the end of the drought that has hurt company earnings over the last six months.
Endesa ended up 1.79 percent at 256-1/2 pesos, while Chilgener firmed 0.55 percent to 2,755 pesos.

Losers included forestry firm Masisa, down 4.53 percent at 205-1/4 pesos, steel-maker Cap, down 1.96 percent at 1,000 pesos and copper products manufacturer Madeco, which shed 0.99 percent at 1,000 pesos.
